text:
When mod_authnz_ldap is used to restrict access to a resource, the LDAP credentials are cached in mod_ldap.

The default setting of LDAPCacheTTL is 600. This allows a user to continue to access a resource for 10 minutes after their credentials have been revoked.

Although this is documented for mod_ldap, it is not exposed in the default httpd config file nor documented with mod_authnz_ldap. A naive administrator may assume that revoking credentials takes effect immediately.

On a server where mod_authnz_ldap gives access to a user's profile, it could allow a user whose account had been locked by an administrator to regain access.

Suggestion: add a caveat to mod_authnz_ldap.html
creator: advax@triumf.ca

text: Thanks for the report, a new section is added to the top of the manual for authnz_ldap.
